channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'I'm past being angry' - Liverpool look for answers to worst run for 71 years
item.description: Where does another humiliating defeat for Liverpool, making it their worst run for 71 years, leave the club and boss Arne Slot?

item.title: Are 'immense' Arsenal most formidable team in Europe?
item.description: Mikel Arteta says Bayern Munich are the "best team in Europe" but, after comprehensively beating them, was this the night Arsenal became serious contenders?

item.title: 'More identity' - Frank takes heart from Spurs defeat at PSG
item.description: Thomas Frank can take encouragement from some aspects of Spurs' latest display, despite defeat to Paris St-Germain, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Van Dijk gives away penalty as PSV take early lead at Anfield
item.description: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk concedes a penalty after handling the ball and Ivan Perisic scores the resulting penalty to give PSV the lead at Anfield.

item.title: Arsenal beat Bayern after dominant second-half display
item.description: Noni Madueke scores his first goal for Arsenal as the Gunners put three past Bayern Munich to maintain their 100% record in the Champions League.

item.title: Forest to reject bids for Anderson - Thursday's gossip
item.description: Nottingham Forest to turn down any bids for Elliot Anderson in January, Crystal Palace considering move for Newcastle United's Joe Willock, Chelsea reopen contact with AC Milan keeper Mike Maignan's camp, plus more.

item.title: PSG come from behind twice in eight-goal thriller against Tottenham
item.description: PSG score five, including a Vitinha hat-trick, as they defeat Tottenham Hotspur 5-3 in a thriller at Parc des Princes.

item.title: Liverpool bad form continues as PSV win at Anfield
item.description: Liverpool's torrid run continues as they suffer a miserable 4-1 home defeat by PSV in the Champions League.

item.title: Liverpool 'stunned' as Driouech puts PSV 3-1 ahead
item.description:
Couhaib Driouech puts PSV 3-1 ahead against Liverpool at Anfield in teh Champions League.
Liverpool go 3-1 down as PSV substitute Couhaib Driouech scores from off the bench.

item.title: 'Brilliant' Saka corner headed home by Timber
item.description: Jurrien Timber gives Arsenal the lead against Bayern Munich at the Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Aubameyang scores rapid double as Marseille beat Newcastle
item.description: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scores twice in five minutes as Marseille beat Newcastle United in the Champions League.

item.title: Ronaldo's World Cup reprieve - special treatment or justified?
item.description: Has Fifa given Cristiano Ronaldo special treatment to get the star player to the 2026 World Cup finals, or have we seen this happen before?

item.title: Disjointed Manchester City lose to Leverkusen
item.description: Pep Guardiola's 100th Champions League game in charge of Manchester City ended in disappointment after the much-changed hosts were stunned by Bayer Leverkusen.

item.title: Liverpool's 'lack of intensity' exposed by PSV
item.description: Champions League analyst Stephen Warnock says that a "lack of intensity" from Liverpool is made it easy for PSV to create opportunities and beat the Premier League champions 4-1 at Anfield.

item.title: How 'absolutely criminal' defending cost Newcastle against Marseille
item.description: Match of the Day's Stephen Warnock explains how Marseille were able to come from behind against Newcastle to win 2-1.

item.title: Estevao stars as Chelsea beat 10-man Barcelona
item.description: Estevao Willian scores a stunning goal as Chelsea comfortably beat 10-man Barcelona 3-0 at Stamford Bridge in the Champions League.

item.title: Mbappe scores four as Real Madrid defeat Olympiacos
item.description: Kylian Mbappe scores four times for Real Madrid to secure a 4-3 win against Olympiacos.

item.title: Napoli earn hard-fought win over Qarabag
item.description: Scott McTominay's header and an own goal from Marko Jankovic give Napoli a crucial home win over Qarabag on 5th anniversary of club legend, Diego Maradona's, death.

item.title: Atalanta score three in five minutes to beat Frankfurt
item.description: After a goalless first half, Atalanta score three in five minutes to beat Eintracht Frankfurt 3-0.

item.title: Spurs show signs of improvement in defeat at PSG
item.description: Champions League analyst Stephen Warnock feels Tottenham took some "baby steps" in terms of improvement in their performance during their 5-3 defeat at PSG.

item.title: Inter's perfect Champions League start ended by Atletico Madrid
item.description: Jose Maria Gimenez scores a last-gasp winner as Atletico Madrid ends Inter Milan's perfect start in the Champions League.

item.title: Bayern's Neuer had a night to forget against Arsenal
item.description: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer is the "star of the show" for the wrong reasons as Champions League analyst Thomas Hitzlsperger looks at his performance against Arsenal.

item.title: WSL sorry after influencer's Spurs joke during draw
item.description: GK Barry makes a series of lewd jokes and accidentally drops a ball back in the bag during the draw for the Women's League Cup quarter-finals and semi-finals.

item.title: Rangers' Raskin felt unfairly portrayed under Martin
item.description: Rangers midfielder Nicolas Raskin felt he was unfairly portrayed after falling out of favour under Russell Martin and is open to extending his contract.

item.title: 10 wins from 11 - the Premier League 'domination' of La Liga
item.description: BBC Sport examines the reasons behind a period of dominance by Premier League teams over their La Liga rivals.

item.title: Paul Doyle pleads guilty to Liverpool parade charges
item.description: Paul Doyle broke down in tears as he admitted seriously injuring fans at Liverpool's victory parade.

item.title: God Save the King played at Republic of Ireland game
item.description: The Republic of Ireland's players sung an a cappella version of the national anthem after God Save the King was played by mistake ahead of a Women's Under-19 European qualifier.

item.title: Champions League teams set to miss Women's League Cup next season
item.description: Teams who qualify for the league phase of the Women's Champions League will no longer participate in the League Cup, under new plans aimed at revamping the competition.

item.title: Why are handball calls causing confusion in Premiership?
item.description: Recent handball incidents within Scottish football have cast fresh confusion over the law. BBC Scotland attempts to make sense of it all.

item.title: Munoz, 13, becomes youngest Uefa Youth League player
item.description: Arsenal's 13-year-old midfielder Luis Munoz becomes the youngest player to feature in the Uefa Youth League.

item.title: Fishlock can inspire 'decisions' for Wales players
item.description: Rhian Wilkinson believes Jess Fishlock can continue to influence Wales' future even though the nation's greatest female footballer has retired from the international game.

item.title: 'It would be the biggest middle finger' - Chilwell eyes World Cup
item.description: Ben Chilwell is keen to show he can go from the Chelsea 'bomb squad' to England's World Cup squad thanks to his move to Strasbourg.

item.title: 'SFA admits Livi should have received penalty'
item.description: Livingston say the Scottish FA has admitted to "a mistake" after they were denied a penalty in Saturday's 2-1 defeat by Rangers.

item.title: 'Start believing the hype' - how 'effortless' Estevao outshone Yamal
item.description: Estevao Willian outshone fellow wonderkid Lamine Yamal with a wondergoal on Tuesday - so is it "time to start believing the hype"?

item.title: Newcastle left bruised by '10 minutes of madness'
item.description: With one away win in seven months, Newcastle United's problems on the road continue as they fall to a 2-1 defeat against Marseille at the Stade Velodrome in the Champions League.

item.title: Flying high but Lampard vows Coventry can get better
item.description: Coventry City are 10 points clear in the Championship and scoring for fun, but Frank Lampard believes they "absolutely can get better".

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign

item.title: Fifa to keep top seeds apart in World Cup for first time
item.description: The top four seeded countries will not be able to meet each other until the semi-finals of next year's World Cup for the first time in the tournament's history.

item.title: Have Premier League's most expensive signings been successful?
item.description: Which of the Premier League's most expensive signings can be considered a success, or a failure, relative to their achievements?

item.title: Pyramid a 'financial disaster' - Pompey owner Eisner
item.description: Portsmouth owner Michael Eisner labels the EFL pyramid a "financial disaster" but says an independent football regular offers hope.

item.title: 'Maybe it was too much' - Guardiola rues defeat after 10 changes
item.description: Pep Guardiola celebrated taking charge of Manchester City for the 100th time in the Champions League on Tuesday night, but it was Bayer Leverkusen and their fans that were left dancing at full-time.

item.title: Hampton voted BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: Chelsea and England goalkeeper Hannah Hampton is voted BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 after a superb 12 months for club and country.

item.title: How Forest tactically exposed Liverpool
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how Nottingham Forest exposed Liverpool's tactical flaws in their 3-0 win at Anfield.

item.title: Why it was always Arsenal for 'part-time barista' Saka
item.description: England winger Bukayo Saka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his love for Arsenal and living in his "coffee era".

item.title: Are you not being entertained? The decline of the open-play goal
item.description: Open-play goals have been on the decline this season and BBC Sport takes a closer look at the trend.

item.title: Have we seen the last of Wales and ex-Arsenal star Ramsey?
item.description: Wales captain Aaron Ramsey has no club and has not played for his country for 14 months, so where and what next for the ex-Arsenal midfielder?

item.title: How does Arsenal defence compare to Premier League's best?
item.description: Where do Arsenal's back four rank in terms of the best ever in the Premier League?

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: When were Coventry last in the Premier League?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team take a look at when Coventry City were last in the Premier League and their chances of promotion.

item.title: Why is Crystal Palace v Man Utd at noon on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Manchester United's trip to Selhurst Park has an unusual kick-off time

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Why are Man Utd not playing on a Saturday for two months?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Manchester United are not playing on a Saturday for two months

item.title: Who is not going to the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at which countries and players will not be competing at the 2026 World Cup

item.title: Who has qualified for World Cup and when is draw?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore when the World Cup draw is, how the seeding works and who has qualified so far.

item.title: Pogba set to make first appearance since doping ban
item.description: Paul Pogba is set to make his long-awaited return from a doping ban for Monaco this weekend.

item.title: Mbappe wants £230m from former club PSG
item.description: France captain Kylian Mbappe is seeking £231.5m from Paris St-Germain, with his former club demanding £211m, as their long-running dispute reaches the Paris courts.

item.title: Hamraoui 'forced out of PSG' after iron bar attack
item.description: Former Paris St-Germain midfielder Kheira Hamraoui files a £3m claim against the French club, alleging she was forced out after being attacked with an iron bar.

item.title: Drenthe's manager confident of 'successful recovery' from stroke
item.description: Royston Drenthe's manager remains confident the former Real Madrid and Everton winger will make "a successful recovery" after his stroke.

item.title: Rice, Yamal and Brentford women's goal among Puskas & Marta nominees
item.description: Brentford women's Ashley Cheatley is included alongside Declan Rice and Lamine Yamal on Fifa's shortlist for the best goals of the past year.

item.title: Real's Endrick closes in on Lyon loan
item.description: Real Madrid are in advanced talks with Lyon over sending 19-year-old forward Endrick on loan to the Ligue 1 side in January.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
